;;2022 年 6 月 13 日，美国加利福尼亚州洛杉矶，通胀上升影响消费者价格，人们在超市购物。 REUTERS/Lucy Nicholson ;
;

;由于能源产品成本飙升，8月份美国进口价格涨幅超出预期，但潜在的进口价格压力仍然较低，这对国内整体通胀前景来说是个好兆头。

;

;美国劳工部周五表示，上个月进口价格上涨 0.5%。 7 月份数据下调，显示价格上涨 0.1%，而不是之前报告的 0.4%。路透社调查的经济学家此前预测，不含关税的进口价格将上涨 0.3%。

;

;截至 8 月份的 12 个月里，进口价格继 7 月份下降 4.6% 后下降 3.0%。年度进口价格现已连续七个月下降。

;

;本周的数据显示，通货膨胀率稳步向美联储 2% 的目标迈进，其潜在的;消费者;和;8 月份生产者价格小幅上涨。

;

;然而，汽油价格上涨推高了整体消费者和生产者价格。预计美联储下周三将维持利率不变。自2022年3月以来，央行已将基准隔夜利率上调525个基点，至目前的5.25%-5.50%区间。

;

;上月进口燃油价格上涨6.7%，创2022年3月以来最大涨幅继 7 月份上涨 2.2% 后。食品价格上涨0.7%。不包括燃料和食品，进口价格继 7 月份出现类似下降后下降了 0.2%。

;

;这些所谓的核心进口价格在 8 月份同比下降了 1.3%。

;< 8 月份进口资本货物价格下降 0.2%。进口机动车价格下降0.1%。除机动车以外的进口消费品成本反弹0.1%。

;

;自中国进口商品价格上涨0.1%，为2022年10月以来首次上涨。中国进口价格同比下降2.2% 8 月同比增长。

;

;从加拿大、欧盟和墨西哥进口的商品价格也逐月上涨。

;

;报告还显示，2019 年出口价格上涨 1.3%。继 7 月上涨 0.5% 后，8 月创 2022 年 5 月以来最大涨幅。受大豆、玉米、小麦和坚果价格下跌的拉动，农产品出口价格下降 2.2%。

;

;非农产品出口价格上涨 1.7%，也是 2022 年 5 月以来的最大涨幅。它们受到价格上涨的推动非农工业用品和材料、资本货物和汽车的价格上涨，足以抵消消费品和非农食品价格下降的影响。

;

;8月份出口价格同比下降5.5%，继下降之后7 月份为 8.0%。

;美国的制裁通常禁止美国人与目标对象进行交易。

;;西班牙足协前主席路易斯·鲁维亚莱斯 (Luis Rubiales) 于周五（9 月 15 日）抵达马德里高等法院，就女足国家队明星詹妮弗·埃尔莫索 (Jennifer Hermoso) 提起的刑事诉讼对他提起的刑事诉讼作证。该投诉源于据称他主动亲吻球员珍妮·埃尔莫索（Jenni Hermoso）的嘴唇，这引发了西班牙体育界和社会对性别歧视的愤怒;
;

;西班牙检察官周五要求发布限制令，以阻止前足球运动员主席路易斯·鲁维亚莱斯 (Luis Rubiales) 接近国家队队员珍妮·埃尔莫索 (Jenni Hermoso)，后者因亲吻她的嘴唇而出庭接受性侵犯调查。

;

;这起事件发生在西班牙女队夺冠后的颁奖典礼上。 8 月 20 日在澳大利亚悉尼举行的世界杯在西班牙体育和社会中引发了对性别歧视的愤怒，并引发了类似于“Me Too”运动的抗议活动。

;

;46 岁的鲁比亚莱斯坚称，这个吻是这是双方自愿的，而埃尔莫索说这是被迫的。

;

;如果获得批准，该命令将阻止鲁维亚莱斯试图联系她或进入距离她 500 米范围内。

;

;穿着黑色西装在持续约一个小时的闭门调查听证会结束后，鲁维亚莱斯身穿白衬衫与律师奥尔加·图鲍一起离开马德里高等法院。他没有对在外面等待的媒体发表讲话。

;

;根据检察官办公室的一份声明，鲁维亚莱斯在作证期间否认了这些指控。

;

;在数周抵制球员的电话后，政治家和妇女团体辞去西班牙皇家足球联合会 (RFEF) 主席鲁维亚莱斯的职务 ;终于在 9 月 10 日辞职了。

;

;但他仍然不悔，说他是在庆祝和欢乐的时刻同意这样做的。

;

;当他上法庭时，当地媒体报道称，包括世界杯冠军球队在内的女球员计划继续抵制国家队，直到联合会的结构发生进一步变化。

;

;在埃尔莫索告诉检察官鲁维亚莱斯吻了她之后州检察官玛尔塔·杜兰特斯·吉尔 (Marta Durantez Gil) 提出司法申诉。

;

;在 Hermoso 表示，她在未经她同意的情况下用双手抱住自己的头，并在未经她同意的情况下用嘴舔她的嘴，数百万人在电视上看到了这一时刻。

;

;在 Hermoso 说她她的亲属受到鲁维亚莱斯及其随行人员的压力，要求说她已经批准了所发生的事情。

;

;弗朗西斯科·德·豪尔赫法官领导了调查，该调查必须先于西班牙法律规定的任何正式指控，并将决定是否案件进入审判阶段。如果确实如此，他可能会被判入狱一到四年。

;

;“在刑事诉讼中，能够证明同意变得至关重要，”马丁内斯·埃切瓦里亚律师事务所合伙人、法律专家贡萨洛·希门尼斯 (Gonzalo Jimenez) 说。< /p>;

;他说，重要的是要证明恶意或故意，才能将性行为作为侵犯进行惩罚。

;

;德豪尔赫已命令包括国家广播公司 TVE 在内的媒体向他发送该事件的录像以及随后的视频，例如球员们在公共汽车上与鲁维亚莱斯庆祝的视频，并以一种看似轻松的方式提到了这个吻。调查可能需要几个月的时间。

;

;这起法律案件也将是对左翼联合政府旗舰“Solo sí es sí”（只有是是是）法律的公开考验，该法律将同意置于“同意”的核心位置。性关系。

;

;许多球员、体育机构和政界人士在社交媒体上围绕#SeAcabó（结束）标签发起的一场运动中支持埃尔莫索。

;

;超过 80 名西班牙高层人士在 RFEF 管理层阵容和风格发生变化之前，包括 23 名世界冠军在内的女球员拒绝为国家队效力。

;

;周五，球员们告诉 RFEF，她们将继续参加国家队比赛。尽管鲁维亚莱斯辞职并且;更换了球队教练豪尔赫·维尔达;和他的助理蒙特塞·托梅。

;

;周四，警方;逮捕了三名皇家马德里青年球员;，罪名是涉嫌传播未成年人的性视频。

;

; 警方称，加那利群岛一名 16 岁女孩的母亲对该视频提出投诉，她称该视频是在未经她同意的情况下拍摄的。

; Fri, 15 Sep 2023 21:25:04 +0800 Global hunger worse today than in 2015, imperiling UN goals -reporthttps://reuters.com/article/global-food-hunger/global-hunger-worse-today-than-in-2015-imperiling-un-goals-report-idUSKBN30L12O

;

;当今世界中度至重度饥饿人口比 2015 年增加了 7.45 亿，世界还很遥远联合国在周五的一份报告中表示，正在努力实现到 2030 年消除饥饿的雄心勃勃的联合国目标。

;

;距离实现 2030 年可持续发展议程的最后期限已过半，粮食及农业组织在下周于纽约举行的联合国可持续发展峰会之前发布的报告称，世界上大多数与粮食和农业相关的目标几乎没有任何改善。

;

;报告称：“COVID-19 大流行的挥之不去的影响，以及气候变化和武装冲突等其他危机，正在产生广泛的影响。” “过去二十年取得的进展停滞不前，在某些情况下甚至出现逆转。”

;

;随着疫情扰乱粮食市场并推高失业率，全球粮食不安全状况在 2020 年急剧上升，但饥饿尚未恢复。大流行前的水平。报告称，到 2022 年，全球约 29.6% 的人口（即 24 亿人）处于中度或严重粮食不安全状态，而 2015 年这一数字为 17.5 亿。

;

;南半球国家的营养不良情况最严重，饥饿加剧大多数在撒哈拉以南非洲地区。

;

;世界在实现将食物浪费减半的目标方面也没有取得任何进展，自 2016 年以来，食物浪费率一直保持在 13% 左右。报告称，各国应制定减少食物损失的政策

;

;;路透社去年11月报道< /a>; 全球在食物浪费问题上缺乏进展的原因是公共投资不足、政策不明确以及浪费的消费习惯。

;

;世界还远未实现保护鱼类资源、保护森林、并扭转土地退化。在提高用水效率和遏制非法捕捞方面取得了一些进展。

;苹果;(AAPL.O); 周五承诺在法国更新 iPhone 12 的软件，以解决有关辐射水平的争议，但其他欧洲国家的担忧表明该公司可能不得不在其他地方采取类似行动。

;

;法国本周暂停销售 ;iPhone 12 手机;经过测试，据称发现其超出了辐射暴露限制。

;

;苹果对调查结果提出异议，称 iPhone 12 已获得多个国际机构的认证，符合全球标准，但表示周五，它将发布软件更新，以适应法国使用的测试方法。

;

;研究人员在过去二十年中进行了大量研究，以评估手机的健康风险。据世界卫生组织称，尚未确定它们对健康造成任何不良影响。

;

;但法国的辐射警告是基于与其他国家不同的测试结果，引起了整个欧洲的担忧。

;

;比利时表示将进行自己的审查，而德国表示正在与法国当局联系以寻找欧盟范围内的解决方案。目前尚不清楚这是否可能包括整个欧盟的软件升级。

;

;与此同时，据政府消息人士透露，意大利将要求苹果升级该国 iPhone 12 的软件。

;

; >;

;荷兰数字基础设施管理局表示，它也在进行自己的调查，并将在两周内进行调查，并与苹果以及德国和法国当局保持联系。该机构表示已接到相关消费者的电话。

;

;法国政府对苹果的软件更新表示欢迎，表示将迅速进行测试，并应允许销售 2020 年推出的相对较旧的 iPhone 12 型号，以

;

;“我们将为法国用户发布软件更新，以适应法国监管机构使用的协议。我们期待 iPhone 12 继续在法国销售，”苹果在一份声明中表示。< /p>;

;“这与法国监管机构使用的特定测试协议有关，并非安全问题。”

;

;苹果定期为其手机和电脑提供软件更新，主要是为了修复问题安全问题。他们可以专注于特定型号或某个地区，有时苹果会在一个月内多次发布此类更新。

;

;法国国家频率局 (ANFR) 周二表示，iPhone 12 的比吸收率 (SAR) ) - 身体从设备吸收射频能量的比率的衡量标准 - 是 ;高于法律允许的;，导致销售暂停。

;

;2020 年法国法规发生变化，允许测试四肢（手持手机）的 SAR 以及头部和身体，用于其他地方。 iPhone 12 未能通过的法国肢体 SAR 测试中，其测量距离为 0 毫米，而人体测试则为 5 毫米距离。

;

;“最终我怀疑整个事件很快就会被遗忘，”本·伍德说CCS Insight 首席分析师强调，iPhone 12 是一款旧机型。

;更大的问题可能是潜在的召回，法国曾威胁说，如果苹果拒绝进行软件更新，就会发生召回。< /p>;

;

;这家美国公司没有按国家/地区或型号细分其销量。

;The Kasbah La Dame Bija guesthouse in Morocco's picturesque Ouirgane Valley escaped unscathed from an earthquake that devastated the area, but the owner's bookings collapsed and he worries about whether the region can revive its tourist appeal .

;"The earthquake killed people and destroyed villages on which our tourism activity depends," said Abderrahim Bouchbouk, owner of the nine-room guesthouse that was once run by his grandfather.

;

; Coping with the human tragedy of a Sept. 8 ; tremor; that killed more than 2,900 people is everyone's immediate concern, but for a region that relied on tourists trekking along stunning valleys and mountain passes, buying local handicrafts or visiting now devastated sites, the economic future looks bleak.

;

;"No tourists, no job, no income," said Mohamed Aznag, a waiter in a café in the shattered village of Tasa Ouirgane who lost his daughter in the earthquake and now fears for his livelihood that supported the rest of his family.

;

;He spoke as he observed the ruins of Dar Izergane guesthouse, which collapsed in the quake, close to the damaged and now empty cafe where he works.

;

;Whole villages, many dominated by homes and buildings made of mud brick, crumbled into mounds of dirt when the 6.8 magnitude quake struck, burying those inside and destroying businesses in a region that depended on the tourist trail.

;

;Tourism offered vital extra earnings for many, with few other work opportunities outside tilling the land on smallholdings.

;

;"That was a way for many local farmers to make additional revenue," said Bouchbouk, whose Kasbah La Dame guesthouse employs 14 people.< /p>;

;Ahmed Bassim, a tourist guide in the Ouirgane area who has been forced to live in a tent for shelter since the earthquake, said the region was in desperate need of reconstruction. "But I hope tourists would still visit in solidarity with us," he said.

;

;The region, one of Morocco's poorest, lies close to Marrakech, a popular tourist destination with luxurious hotels, fancy shopping centres and a historic souk.

;

;Many hope plans for a gathering of the World Bank and International Monetary Fund, scheduled for ;Oct. 9-15; in Marrakech, will not be disrupted by the earthquake.

;

;Lahcen Zelmat, head of the Morocco's tourism industry federation, said the long-planned event "would be a chance for Morocco to promote Marrakech destination again after the earthquake."

;

;Defence Minister Li Shangfu, who has been missing from public view for more than two weeks, has been placed under investigation by Chinese authorities, according to 10 people familiar with the matter.

;

;The investigation into Li relates to procurement of military equipment, according to a regional security official and three people in direct contact with the Chinese military. Reuters was unable to obtain details on which equipment purchases were under scrutiny.

;

;Eight senior officials from the Chinese military's procurement unit, which Li led from 2017 to 2022, are also under investigation, according to two of the people in direct contact with the military.

;

;The probe into Li, who was appointed as defence minister in March, and the eight officials is being carried out by the military's powerful disciplinary inspection commission, those two people said.

;

;Reuters' detailed examination of the allegations against Li and the timing of the probe is based on interviews with sources who interact regularly with senior Chinese political and defence leaders, and regional officials with close knowledge of Chinese politics.

;

;A Chinese Foreign Ministry spokeswoman told reporters Friday that she was not aware of the situation. The State Council and the Defence Ministry did not immediately return requests for comment. Li could not immediately be reached.

;

;The Financial Times reported on Friday, citing US officials, that the US government believes Li has been placed under investigation. The Wall Street Journal cited a person close to decision making in Beijing as saying he had been taken away last week for questioning.

;

;The US State Department didn't immediately respond to a request for comment on the media reports that US intelligence officials believed Li was under investigation for corruption.

;

;US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel on Friday posed the question on X, formerly Twitter, whether Li was under house arrest. The US embassy in Tokyo did not immediately have further comment.

;

;Li was last seen in Beijing on Aug. 29 giving a key-note speech at a security forum with African nations. Earlier that month, he also visited Russia and Belarus.

;

;The probe into the minister started shortly after his return from that trip, according to a person in direct contact with the military and two foreign security officials briefed on the case.

;

;By Sept. 3, his ministry had cancelled a visit by Li to Vietnam for an annual defence meeting between the two countries scheduled for Sept. 7-8, according to a Vietnamese official. Beijing told officials in Hanoi that Li had a ;"health condition"; when it postponed the event, two Vietnamese officials said.

;

;Li's failure to attend that meeting, and talks with a senior Singaporean military official in China the same week, raised questions among regional diplomats and social media users about his whereabouts.

;

;The probe into Li follows China's unexplained replacement of Foreign Minister Qin Gang in July after a prolonged absence from public view and a shake-up of the leadership of the People's Liberation Army's elite Rocket Force, which is responsible for conventional and nuclear missiles. Chinese officials initially said Qin's absence was also due to health reasons.

;

;The moves have raised questions from some observers and diplomats about the abrupt changes in China's leadership at a time when its economy is struggling to recover from strict pandemic closures and its relations with the United States have further soured over a range of issues.

;

;Both Li and Qin were seen by observers ok Chinese politics as handpicked by President Xi Jinping, making their absence after less than a year on the job particularly notable. The two men had prominent public-facing roles and also serve among China's five state councillors, a post outranking a regular minister.

;

;In July, the military's procurement unit took the highly unusual step of issuing a notice that it was looking to "clean-up" its bidding process. It invited the public to report irregularities dating back to Oct. 2017, when Li was at its helm. He ran the unit until October 2022.

;

;When asked last month by reporters to comment about the whereabouts of two other former senior military leaders who had not been recently seen in public and if they were under investigation, a Defence Ministry spokesman said the military has "zero-tolerance for corruption", without denying the possibility that they were the subject of a probe.

;

;"We must always blow the horn, investigate every case, punish every instance of corruption and resolutely win the hard and protracted battle against corruption," the spokesman said.

;

;In 2016, Li was named deputy commander of the military's then-new Strategic Support Force - an elite body tasked with accelerating the development of space and cyber warfare capabilities. He was then tasked the following year with heading the military's procurement unit.

;

;Li was sanctioned by the US in 2018 over weapons purchases from Russia's largest arms exporter, Rosoboronexport.

;

;Beijing has repeatedly said it wants those sanctions dropped to facilitate better discussions between the Chinese and US militaries. US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin sought talks with Li during a defence conference in Singapore in June, but did not get ;beyond pleasantries;, according to a Pentagon spokesman.
